Hi..
 
I am thinking about buying this book.. and what they advise to me?
 =

This book is a good book to study unit tests ?
 
Regards!

Elliotte Rusty =
Harold <elharo@...> escreveu:
I'm implementing a sample TestLis=
tener. I've encountered a number of 
unclear points I wanted to ask about. =
Here's the interface:

package org.junit.runner;

import java.lang.reflect.=
Method;


public interface TestListener {

      void testRunStarted(int te=
stCount);
      
      void testRunFinished(Runner runner); //TODO: Somethi=
ng is wrong here... 
Should take an event anyway
      
      void testStar=
ted(Object test, String name);

      void testFinished(Object test, String=
 name);

      void testFailure(Failure failure);

      void testIgnored(M=
ethod method);

}


1. What is the first argument passed to the testStarted=
 and testFinished 
class? I assume this is the actual test object which in =
JUnit 4 can 
extend any class. Is it really helpful to pass this given that=
 it's only 
an object of unspecified type and in practice may have any type=
?

2. Why does testIgnored() get a Method when testFailure gets a Failure? =

Should there be an Ignored class? Or should testFailure take a method 
ins=
tead? These two feel out of sync.

3. Does testFinished always bracket test=
Started? i.e. does 
testFailure/testIgnored go in between started and finis=
hed or does it 
replace testFinished?


--
